item.title: Rodica add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "To fall in love is to create a religion that has a fallible god." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Rodica add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "Reality is not always probable, or likely." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Rodica add a quote by Laurel Thatcher Ulrich
item.description: "Well-behaved women seldom make history." -- Laurel Thatcher Ulrich

item.title: Rodica add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "If you can make a woman laugh, you can make her do anything." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Rodica add a quote by Joseph Conrad
item.description: "Being a woman is a terribly difficult task, since it consists principally in dealing with men." -- Joseph Conrad

item.title: Rodica add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Rodica add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "Metaphors are dangerous. Love begins with a metaphor. Which is to say, love begins at the point when a woman enters her first word into our poetic memory." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Rodica add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "There is a certain part of all of us that lives outside of time. Perhaps we become aware of our age only at exceptional moments and most of the time we are ageless." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Rodica add a quote by Benjamin Disraeli
item.description: "There are three types of lies -- lies, damn lies, and statistics." -- Benjamin Disraeli

item.title: Rodica add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Rodica add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Women and cats will do as they please, and men and dogs should relax and get used to the idea." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Rodica add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Nothing in the real world is as beautiful as the illusions of a person about to lose consciousness." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Rodica add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Rodica add a quote by Allen Saunders
item.description: "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans." -- Allen Saunders

item.title: Rodica add a quote by E.E. Cummings
item.description: "It takes courage to grow up and become who you really are." -- E.E. Cummings

item.title: Rodica add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description: "When it comes to men who are romantically interested in you, itâ€™s really simple. Just ignore everything they say and only pay attention to what they do." -- Randy Pausch

item.title: Rodica add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "People believe, thought Shadow. It's what people do. They believe, and then they do not take responsibility for their beliefs; they conjure things, and do not trust the conjuration. People populate the darkness; with ghost, with gods, with electrons, with tales. People imagine, and people believe; and it is that rock solid belief, that makes things happen." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Rodica add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "Happiness in intelligent people is the rarest thing I know." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Rodica add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "The unreal is more powerful than the real. Because nothing is as perfect as you can imagine it. Because its only intangible ideas, concepts, beliefs, fantasies that last. Stone crumbles. Wood rots. People, well, they die. But things as fragile as a thought, a dream, a legend, they can go on and on. If you can change the way people think. The way they see themselves. The way they see the world. You can change the way people live their lives. That's the only lasting thing you can create." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Rodica add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "Rant would tell people: 'You're a different human being to everybody you meet." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Rodica add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "To repeat, the way you get to the huge, impossible yes is, you start collecting a lot of easy, small yeses." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Rodica add a quote by Haruki Marukami
item.description: "Whatever it is you're seeking won't come in the form you're expecting." -- Haruki Marukami

item.title: Rodica add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "In this world, there are things you can only do alone, and things you can only do with somebody else. It's important to combine the two in just the right amount." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Rodica add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Don't feel sorry for yourself. Only assholes do that." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Rodica add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "It's like Tolstoy said. Happiness is an allegory, unhappiness a <i>story</i>." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Rodica add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Silence, I discover, is something you can actually hear." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Rodica add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Most everything you think you know about me is nothing more than memories." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Rodica add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Spend your money on the things money can buy. Spend your time on the things money canâ€™t buy." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Rodica add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Life doesn't require ideals. It requires standards of action." -- Haruki Murakami
